greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of partitions of n into parts of exactly k sorts; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
T:= (n, k)-> add(b(n$2, k-i)*(-1)^i*binomial(k, i), i=0..k):
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, b[n, i - 1, k] + If[i>n, 0, k*b[n-i, i, k]]]]; T[n_, k_] := Sum[b[n, n, k -i]*(-1)^i* Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 22 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Columns k=0-1 give: A000007, A000041 (for n>0).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 12 2015
